title.p: AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF KOREA AND THE GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF TUNISIA ON THE ENCOURAGEMENT AND RECIPROCAL PROTECTION OF INVESTMENTS

preamble.p: The Government of the Republic of Korea and the Government of the Republic of Tunisia,
Desiring to strengthen bilateral economic cooperation,
Desiring to create favourable conditions for a capital investment by legal and natural persons who are nationals of one Contracting Party in the territory of the other contracting party,
Desiring to intensify cooperation between private enterprises particularly in the fields of science and technology and productivity
Recognizing the need to protect investments of nationals and companies of both parties and to stimulate the transfer of capital for the economic prosperity of both countries;

div.p: Cheque Contracting Party shall promote as far as possible investments made in its territory by nationals or companies of the other Contracting Party and admit such investments in accordance with its laws and regulations.

Each Contracting Party undertakes in its territory provide fair and equitable treatment to investments or property rights and interests of citizens, natural or legal persons of the other contracting party and to ensure the enjoyment of the right thus recognized is not hindered by unjustified or discriminatory measures.

To this end, each Contracting Party shall allow such investments, property rights and interests at least the same security and protection as it provides to those of its own nationals or investments of nationals and companies of third States.

Each Contracting Party in whose territory investments have been made by nationals or companies of the other Contracting Party shall accord them in a legislation and its Regulations, the free transfer of:
• The actual net profits, interest, dividends, royalties from natural or legal persons who are nationals of one of the two countries.
• The proceeds of the total or partial liquidation of investments approved by the country in which they are carried out.
• The product of a party adequate labour nationals entitled to exercise their activities in the territory of either of the Contracting Parties.

This Agreement shall also apply to investments in the territory of one Contracting Party effected in accordance with the egislation prior to the entry into force of this Agreement by nationals or companies of the other contracting party.

For the purposes of this Agreement:
(a) The term "nationals" means natural persons who according to the laws of each Contracting Party shall be regarded as nationals of that State.

(b) The dreary "legal person" means companies or firms or associations, whether or not with limited liability, whether profit-making or not incorporated in the territory of each Contracting Party and L existing also in accordance with its laws and regulations relating thereto and in which nationals of each Contracting Party shall, directly or indirectly, a preponderant interest.

(c) The term "investment" includes all categories of goods and in particular, though not exclusively: ownership of movable and immovable property as well as any other rights in rem such as mortgages, pledge, usufruits Suret S, R and similar rights; shares and other forms of equity participation; Monetary claims and rights to any performance having an economic value; copyrights, industrial property rights, Proc d S technical know-how, trademarks, trade names; the concessions under public law, including concessions to search for and exploit resources extract naturelles. ownership of movable and immovable property as well as any other rights in rem such as mortgages, pledge, usufruits Suret S, R and similar rights; shares and other forms of equity participation; Monetary claims and rights to any performance having an economic value; copyrights, industrial property rights, Proc d S technical know-how, trademarks, trade names; the concessions under public law, including concessions to search for and extract exploit natural resources.

Pursuant to the Convention on the Settlement of Investment Disputes signed on 18 March 1965 and the application of a national or a juridical person of one of the two Contracting Parties which considers to have suffered damage resulting from the breach of the provisions of this Agreement, the other Contracting Party undertakes D to J and irrevocably undergo the Proc lasts conciliation.
This commitment implies the renunciation of the requirement to exhaust prior to recourse to judicial and administrative bodies.
1. If any dispute should arise between the contracting parties concerning the interpretation or the implementation of the provisions of this Agreement shall be settled through diplomatic channels.
